item.title: 经销商数据显示，特斯拉第二季度加州注册量下降 24
item.description: 加州新车经销商协会的一份报告显示，特斯拉汽车第二季度在加州的注册量下降了 24%，这表明这家电动汽车制造商面临的挑战越来越大。【原文：Registrations of Tesla cars in California fell 24% in the second quarter, signaling mounting challenges for the electric-vehicle maker, according to a report by the California New Car Dealers Association.】

item.title: 消息人士称，如果数据支持，欧洲央行鹰派对 9 月降息持开放态度
item.description: 四位直接了解讨论情况的消息人士称，即使是欧洲央行一些较为鹰派的决策者也对 9 月份降息持开放态度，前提是新的数据证实通货紧缩仍在继续。【原文：Even some of the European Central Bank's more hawkish policymakers are open to an interest rate cut in September, provided incoming data confirm that disinflation is continuing, four sources with direct knowledge of the discussion said.】

item.title: 特立尼达法院重申承认康菲石油公司对委内瑞拉的索赔要求
item.description: 特立尼达和多巴哥高等法院周四重申了一项裁决，承认美国石油生产商康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）对委内瑞拉提出的仲裁请求，该裁决可能会冻结这个加勒比国家向其邻国支付的天然气联合项目费用。【原文：Trinidad and Tobago's High Court on Thursday reaffirmed a decision recognizing U.S. oil producer ConocoPhillips' arbitration claim against Venezuela, which could freeze the Caribbean country's payments to its neighbor for joint natural gas projects.】

item.title: 洗钱担忧引关注，阿根廷期待驯服加密货币市场
item.description: 专家表示，阿根廷旨在减少与数字资产相关的洗钱等风险，一项新的法律可能有助于阿根廷规范其蓬勃发展的加密货币市场。【原文：A new law could help Argentina regulate its booming cryptocurrency market as the country aims to reduce risks such as money-laundering associated with the digital assets, experts say.】

item.title: 保险经纪公司 TWFG 首次上市股价上涨近 30
item.description: 保险经纪公司 TWFG 的股价周四在纳斯达克首次亮相时上涨了近 30%，表明随着美国首次公开募股市场的复苏，投资者对新股的需求强劲。【原文：Insurance broker TWFG's shares gained nearly 30% in their Nasdaq debut on Thursday, signaling strong investor demand for new stocks as the U.S. initial public offering market aims for a recovery.】

item.title: 观望的欧洲央行推动欧元卷土重来，美元之王的宝座旁落
item.description: 周四，由于欧洲央行在预期的9月份第二次降息后转为谨慎的前景扫除了欧元走势中对法国政治的焦虑，交易员们保持了欧元强劲反弹的势头。【原文：Traders on Thursday kept the euro on course for a strong comeback as prospects for the European Central Bank turning cautious after an expected second rate cut in September swept anxiety about French politics out of the currency's path.】

item.title: 谷歌为美国转播巴黎奥运会带来人工智能技术
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周四与 NBC 环球公司、美国奥委会和残奥委会共同表示，谷歌将在巴黎奥运会的美国转播中注入人工智能，让体育解说员使用人工智能解说比赛。【原文：Alphabet's Google will infuse artificial intelligence into the U.S. broadcast of the Paris Olympics, allowing sports commentators to use AI to explain competitions, the tech company said on Thursday alongside NBCUniversal and the U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Committee.】

item.title: 拉丁美洲航空公司准备在纽约证券交易所上市，潜在估值 85 亿美元
item.description: 拉塔姆航空公司周四表示，该公司正准备将其股票在纽约证券交易所上市，此举可能为其带来 85 亿美元的估值。【原文：LATAM Airlines is preparing to list its shares on the New York Stock Exchange in a move that could fetch it a valuation of $8.5 billion, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: OpenAI 推出更便宜的小型人工智能模型 GPT-4o mini
item.description: ChatGPT 制造商 OpenAI 周四表示，它将推出一款高性价比的小型人工智能模型 GPT-4o mini，旨在使其技术更经济实惠、能耗更低，从而使初创公司能够面向更广泛的客户群。【原文：ChatGPT maker OpenAI said on Thursday it was launching GPT-4o mini, a cost-efficient small AI model, aimed at making its technology more affordable and less energy intensive, allowing the startup to target a broader pool of customers.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果公司正在洽谈更多好莱坞电影的授权事宜
item.description: 彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道称，苹果公司正在与好莱坞电影公司洽谈更多电影的授权事宜，以增强其 Apple TV+ 流媒体服务的产品组合。【原文：Apple is in talks to license more films from Hollywood studios to boost its portfolio on Apple TV+ streaming service, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国工会就仓库投票向亚马逊提出法律挑战
item.description: 英国一家工会对亚马逊提出法律挑战，指控这家美国电子商务巨头不适当地影响仓库工人投票反对成立工会。【原文：A British union has filed a legal challenge against Amazon , accusing the U.S. ecommerce giant of inappropriately influencing warehouse workers to vote against unionisation.】

item.title: Adobe 称亚马逊 Prime Day 将美国网络销售额提升至 142 亿美元
item.description: 据 Adobe Analytics 周四发布的一份报告显示，在为期 48 小时的亚马逊 "Prime Day "活动期间，美国购物者在各零售商处的在线消费额约为 142 亿美元。【原文：Shoppers spent about $14.2 billion online across retailers in the United States during the 48-hour Amazon Prime Day event, according to a report from Adobe Analytics on Thursday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称美国应提高税收，等到 2024 年底再降息
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周四表示，美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）在 "2024年末 "之前不应降息，政府需要提高税收以减缓联邦债务的增长--包括对年收入低于总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）提出的40万美元门槛的家庭进行征税。【原文：The International Monetary Fund on Thursday said the U.S. Federal Reserve should not cut interest rates until "late 2024" and the government needs to raise taxes to slow the growing federal debt -- including on households earning less than President Joe Biden's $400,000-a-year threshold.】

item.title: 大型央行开始缓慢降息
item.description: 事实证明，各主要央行放宽货币政策的步伐要比从 2021 年下半年开始竞相加息以抑制飙升的通胀率慢得多。【原文：The move to ease monetary policy among major central banks is proving much slower than the race to jack up interest rates from late 2021 to curtail surging inflation.】

item.title: 得益于公务机和直升机需求，德事隆季度利润增长
item.description: 德事隆（Textron）周四公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是其生产私人飞机和军用直升机的各项业务需求增加。【原文：Textron beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Thursday, on higher demand across its businesses that make private jets and military helicopters.】

item.title: 代理顾问 Glass Lewis 建议 Enhabit 投资者选举三名 AREX 被提名者
item.description: 代理咨询公司 Glass Lewis 周四表示，Enhabit 股东应选举三名 AREX Capital Management 董事候选人进入九人董事会。【原文：Proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis said on Thursday Enhabit shareholders should elect three AREX Capital Management director candidates to the nine-member board.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数增幅超过预期
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数增幅超过预期，但劳动力市场并未出现实质性变化，而且由于暑假和工厂临时关闭，7 月份的数据通常比较嘈杂。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits rose more than expected last week, but there has been no material shift in the labor market and the data is typically noisy in July because of summer breaks and temporary factory closures.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，Meta 探索入股雷朋制造商 EssilorLuxottica
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，Meta Platforms 探索对眼镜集团 EssilorLuxottica 进行数十亿欧元的投资。【原文：Meta Platforms has explored a multibillion-euro investment in eyewear group EssilorLuxottica , the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧洲央行维持利率不变，为九月份留有余地
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）周四继续按兵不动，重申在进一步降低利率之前，需要看到更多的证据表明通胀正在向其目标回归。【原文：The European Central Bank kept borrowing costs on hold on Thursday, repeating that it needed to see more evidence that inflation was heading back to its goal before lowering interest rates further.】

item.title: 由于需求不振，KeyCorp 预计年均贷款将出现更大降幅
item.description: 周四，KeyCorp 预测 2024 年平均贷款降幅将大于此前预期，并公布第二季度利润下降 5%，原因是存款成本上升侵蚀了这家地区性贷款机构的利息收入，导致其股价在盘前交易中下跌 2%。【原文：KeyCorp forecast a bigger drop in average loans in 2024 than previously anticipated on Thursday, and posted a 5% fall in second-quarter profit as costlier deposits eroded the regional lender's interest income, sending its shares down 2% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 福特在加拿大工厂从电动汽车计划转向重型卡车
item.description: 福特汽车公司周四宣布，计划将其在加拿大的一家工厂用于生产未来的电动汽车，转而生产其旗舰产品F系列皮卡的汽油动力车型。【原文：Ford Motor on Thursday outlined plans to use a Canadian plant it had earmarked for a future electric vehicle to instead build larger, gasoline-powered versions of its flagship F-Series pickup truck.】

item.title: 雅培上调年度盈利预期，原因是医疗器械销售强劲
item.description: 雅培制药公司周四上调了全年盈利预期，第二季度盈利超出华尔街预期，主要得益于其心脏和糖尿病护理设备的强劲销售。【原文：Abbott Laboratories raised its annual profit forecast and beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter earnings on Thursday, buoyed by strong sales of its cardiac and diabetes care devices.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称诺镍克公司正在洽谈在中国建设电池行业镍工厂事宜
item.description: 三位知情人士告诉路透社，俄罗斯镍镉公司正在与几家中国电池公司洽谈建立一家工厂，利用俄罗斯半成品联合生产镍材料。【原文：Russia's Nornickel is in talks with several Chinese battery companies to build a plant jointly producing nickel material from Russian semi-finished products, three sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: Blackstone 因私募股权投资和信贷收益，第二季度利润小幅增长
item.description: Blackstone 周四表示，其第二季度可分配利润同比增长 3%，原因是私募股权投资和信贷部门的资产销售大幅增长，抵消了房地产部门的下滑。【原文：Blackstone said on Thursday its second-quarter distributable earnings rose 3% from a year earlier, as a jump in asset sales in its private equity and credit divisions more than offset a slump in its real estate arm.】

item.title: 标准普尔全球公司称，美国矿业开发时间为全球第二长
item.description: 周四的一份报告称，在美国建设一个新矿平均需要近29年的时间，是世界上仅次于赞比亚的第二长的国家，这阻碍了华盛顿为能源转型而提高锂、镍和其他金属产量的努力。【原文：It takes an average of nearly 29 years to build a new mine in the U.S., the second-longest in the world behind only Zambia, hampering Washington's efforts to boost output of lithium, nickel and other metals for the energy transition, a report said on Thursday.】

item.title: D.R. Horton 季度利润超出预期，宣布回购 40 亿美元股票
item.description: 本周四，D.R. Horton 公司的季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，原因是美国住房供应量处于历史低位，即使在抵押贷款利率居高不下的情况下，新房销售量仍有所提升。【原文：D.R. Horton beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Thursday, as historically low U.S. housing supply lifted sales of new homes even as mortgage rates remained elevated.】

item.title: 印度 Infosys 第一季度收入超预期，上调全年增长预期
item.description: 印度第二大 IT 服务公司 Infosys 周四公布的季度营收超过预期，主要得益于金融服务和制造业客户需求的复苏。【原文：India's No.2 IT services firm Infosys beat quarterly revenue estimates on Thursday, helped by a recovery in demand from clients in its financial services and manufacturing verticals.】

item.title: 多米诺比萨因需求低迷，季度销售额略低于预期
item.description: 周四，多米诺比萨公司（Domino's Pizza）第二季度同店销售额低于市场预期，原因是美国消费者，尤其是低收入群体，减少了外出就餐或叫外卖的消费。【原文：Domino's Pizza fell short of market expectations for second-quarter same-store sales on Thursday as U.S. consumers, particularly in the lower-income group, spent less on eating out or ordering in.】

item.title: 早间竞价：台积电稳定芯片价格，欧洲央行和 Netflix 备受关注
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 消息人士称，埃克森与雪佛龙的冲突取决于赫斯圭亚那资产控制权的变更
item.description: 据知情人士透露，埃克森美孚通过法律手段阻止雪佛龙公司以 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司的提议，关键在于该交易是否会涉及赫斯公司在圭亚那的子公司控制权的变更。【原文：Exxon Mobil's legal bid to stop Chevron's proposed $53 billion acquisition of Hess rests on whether the transaction would involve a change of control of Hess' prize subsidiary in Guyana, according to people knowledgeable about the argument.】
